title: Gamer Tyler "Ninja" Blevins Has All-Day Phone Alarms; The 30-year-old is the most-streamed professional gamer in the world—which is why a 10 percent battery really stresses him out. He shares what's on his phone.
text:
First app checked in the morning

Twitter.

Most-used app

TikTok.

Favorite emoji

The guy with the little sad cute eyes followed by the fingers pointing in at each other.

Favorite picture on your Instagram feed

The picture of Jess and me in the rain in the middle of Times Square on New Year's.

Strangest autocorrect mishap

Always the duck autocorrect.

Most-watched show

Supernatural, on Netflix.

Most-listened-to artist

Juice WRLD, on Spotify.

Craziest place you've left your phone

In an Uber back from a Super Bowl party in Miami.

Most-surprising app you depend on

Shazam. Whenever I'm traveling, I'll randomly hear a song in a restaurantor hotel and quickly pull out Shazam so I can know what it is.

Alarm settings

Pretty much alarms in increments of half hours from 6:30 a.m. to 8 p.m., depending on what my schedule for the day is.

Favorite podcast

Bill Burr. I've watched him for years—before he had his podcast—doing his stand-ups. I think he's hilarious.

Favorite Instagram feeds you follow

@jordanfisher, @timthetatman, @couragejd.

Favorite food-related app

Uber Eats.

Battery level that makes you nervous

Ten percent battery starts to get me stressed. Whenever I travel I have a charger on me at pretty much all times.

Best tweet you read recently

Some people tweeted about dressing up as me for Halloween, and that made my week.

Phone model

Black iPhone 12

Last app checked before bed

TikTok

Homescreen

Vahn from Legend of Legaia.

Gamer Tyler "Ninja" Blevins Has All-Day Phone Alarms
